relation: Generate self governance document for voting rules, quorum and other functional committee requirements

Develop a system to take in applications for all non-chapter meeting events, vet them, and schedule them. This system shall serve as the "official" registration path for all events and allow the GCC to get a firm grip on the OWASP Event Calendar.

Provide unified sponsorship mechanism for all Global AppSec conferences. This will help us plan our conference revenue annually and help sponsors plan for their spending (identified as an issue by several vendors). This is intended to augment, not replace individual conference sponsorships.

Joint venture with the GPC. The track would consist of a cadre (10-20) of speakers from inew/high profile OWASP projects. The GCC would manage these speakers through an internal call for papers that would be vetted by the GCC/GPC for some of our best speakers from high profile projects. As a new conference requests an OWASP Speaking track (or for Global AppSec conferences, this will be required) the GCC would reach out to the selected presenters to verify their availability for the event and provide a list of 6-7 speakers to the local event coordinators for the schedule.
Promote OWASP at targeted industry and developer events. Provide OWASP support and schwag for OWASP booths at other conferences
Provide additional mechanisms for marketing conferences to attendees
Provide additional mechanisms for marketing conferences to Sponsors
Obtain Twitter accounts, domain names, and @owasp.org email addresses for use by approved conferences. See Global Conference Resources
RegOnline is setup. Investigate costs for hiring a conference organizer.
Provide short URLs on the OWASP website (e.g. https://owasp.org/AppSecBR) to make it easier to access content on the wiki, especially in emails and the like
Provide email lists for targeted, regional email distributions. Only GlobalAppSec conferences will be advertised on OWASP-ALL
Provide OWASP Merchandise for sale at conferences
Planning for AppSecUSA release in Sept.
Need to investigate leveraging Salesforce for this.
May be a bit OBE as Kate has established something similar already. May just need an "inventory" we can send places.

textBeforeTable: Major Initiatives Have a profit of $200k in 2011 across all conferences Revise GCC Governance Streamline Sponsorships (Global Conference Sponsors, Targeted Conference Sponsors) Bring more into the fold (Generate 300 new/renewed members at conferences) Reach out to non-members (have 70% of attendees at cons non-members) Reach out to developers (have 20% of attendees in a dev position) Enhance Services for Conference Planners Promote OWASP Projects/Initiatives at OWASP Conferences Have a Global Appsec in NA, SA, EU, Asia in 2011 2011 Comprehensive Committee Plan | 2010 Plan 2011 Goals delete me How to Host a Conference - The comprehensive guide for hosting an OWASP event. textAfterTable: Committee Policies If you have questions or require an exception to any of these please contact the OWASP Staff. Comprehensive tracking of committee votes was not started until January 2011, policies with an NA entered into the "votes" column were conducted before this policy was implemented. Although the Global Conference Committee was retired effective April 1, 2013, the policies established by the committee remain in full effect.
